titleStmt.title: Babels balm: or The honey-combe of Romes religion With a neate draining and straining-out of the rammish honey thereof. Sung in tenne most elegant elegies in Latine, by that most worthy Christian satyrist, Master George Good-vvinne. And translated into tenne English satyres, by the Muses most vnworthy Eccho, Iohn Vicars.
Melissa religionis pontificiae. English
titleStmt.author: Goodwin, George, fl. 1607-1620.
Vicars, John, 1579 or 80-1652.

publicationStmt.publisher: By George Purslowe for Nathanaell Browne, and are to be sold at his shop, at the vpper end of the long walke neere Little S. Bartholomews,

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Melissa religionis pontificiae.
With a dedication to William Herbert, Earl of Pembroke. Variant: cancel dedication to John Egerton, Earl of Bridgewater.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: his shop, at the vpper end of the long walke neere Little S. Bartholomews
